ORDINATION.

ξ 1.--ΤΗΕ ECCLESIASTICAL HiERARGHY.

THE ecclesiastical hierarchy, in its earliest stage, comprised, as we have seen above, three orders, those of the episcopate‚ the priesthood, and the diaconate. The functions of the first two orders could be exercised by men only, but women had been admitted, to a certain extent, to share the duties of the diaconal ministry.
